contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = {{nihongo|Yūnagi Loop|夕凪Loop|}} | Type = studio | Artist = [[Maaya Sakamoto]] | Cover = | Released = October 26, 2005 | Recorded = | Genre = [[J-pop]] | Length = 55:41 | Label = [[Victor Entertainment]] | Producer = [[Mitsuyoshi Tamura]], Maaya Sakamoto | Reviews = | Last album = [[Shōnen Alice]]<br>(2003) | This album = Yūnagi Loop<br>(2005) | Next album = [[30Minutes Night Flight]]<br>(2007) | Misc = <!--{{ }}-->{{Singles | Name = Yūnagi Loop | Type = studio | Single 1 = [[Loop (song)|Loop]] | Single 1 date = May 10, 2005 }} }} {{nihongo|'''Yūnagi Loop'''|夕凪Loop|Peaceful Evening Loop}} is [[Maaya Sakamoto]]'s 5th studio album. Her style changed once again, mostly because [[Yoko Kanno]] did not compose any of the songs. Her voice also changed because of acting in ''[[Les Misérables (musical)|Les Misérables]]''. The first pressing came with a CD-ROM featuring music videos for "Loop" and "Honey Come".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/-/Discography/A008957/VIZL-155.html|title=Yūnagi LOOP Page at JVC Music Website|accessdate=2008-09-03}}</ref> ==Track listing== {{tracklist | collapsed = no | headline = CD (VICL-61755) | total_length = 55:41 | lyrics_credits = yes | music_credits = yes | title1 =
